comment.author: 42264328@N00
comment._content: Pascual Orozco, see other photo. He seems to have lost a lot of weight in this photo--must have been taken later, and he is a General here, not a Colonel That's a sharp suit--very stylish.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content:
Pascual Orozco Vázquez,  (1882-1915) born in Hacienda Santa Inés [other sources say Santa Isabel], near San Isidro,  municipal territory of Guerrero.  His father Pascual Orozco Sr. (you may find a picture of him in this Bain collection, cal nr. LC-B2-2563-11) and his mother Amada Vázquez .  One of the main revolutionaries in Chihuahua during Madero´s rebelion in 1911 Taken from Wikipedia where you can learn more about him. On march 6, 1912 he overturned and rebeled against President Madero launching the "Plan de la Empacadora"
Dr. Roberto Duarte

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content:
Found this picture printed on El Paso Herald, issue August 2, 1912 (The Library of Congress, Chronicling America).
Dr. Roberto Duarte
Plastic Surgeon
